intro: Sida australis, commonly known as Australian sida, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, often found in coastal and sandy soils. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces fluffy, capsule-like fruits. Sida australis is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
